item.description:
**********************************

Agenda:

**********************************

 

 

 

 

 

Sean Martin, Cambridge Semantics: A Semantic Web Startup's Experience. "We've been a startup using Semantic Web technologies to address enterprise data management challenges for about 5 years now. In this 10 minute talk, we'll discuss some of our experiences with applying Semantic Web inside enterprises and also discuss some of the ways in which the market seems to be evolving in a way that requires semantics."

 

 

 

 

 

Ben Szekely, Cambridge Semantics: Anzo--Semantic Web Software for the Enterprise. "This talk will present a soup-to-nuts demo of Anzo, a Semantic Web platform and tool suite for integrating, visualizing, and building applications against structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data. In a single demo, we'll show how Semantic Web technologies make it easy to pull data in on the fly from databases, from spreadsheets, and from unstructured text on the Web."
item.how_to_find_us: Rm 32-D463, 4th floor, Star Conference Room, Stata Center, MIT
item.name: Cambridge Semantic Web Monthly Meetup
